entry.question: During the dialogue between Krishna and Duryodhana, why did Krishna refuse to accept the gifts offered by the Kauravas, and what did this reveal about their intentions?
entry.answer: Krishna refused the gifts because he believed the Kauravas lacked sincere intent to establish peace. Krishna emphasized that their offerings were hollow, highlighting the moral failure of the Kauravas to act with righteousness (dharma).
